subject: Re: New file uploaded to EVP-ITC
author: itcdeadpeople
full_text:
Hi Stefan and Steve.  The closest thing I've gotten to an answer from "Arthur" about how 
this is working is the words 'air' or 'air-to-air.'  This makes little sense to me, unless there 
is some type of additional manipulation taking place acoustically, because I am not 
recording in a closed environment.  I am playing the file from EVP Maker using an external 
speaker and recording using the built-in mic of my MAC. 

I have no idea, what, if any difference this might make in terms of opportunity for 'them' to 
speak intelligent phrases.  Just thought I'd share what I'm hearing.  I'll keep asking, and 
trying to get a clearer explanation of the process (though I've never had much luck with 
that in the past, in regard to getting explanations for the mechanics of any other 
technique!)  

Margaret

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Stefan Bion <yahoogroups@...> wrote:
>
> Hi Steve,
> 
> > The inputed file is just tones, how are they creating words and
> > sentences?  Does anybody have a logical explanation yet?  Energy 
> > fields, Conincidence...etc.
> 
> Well, there are a lot of explanations for this, but none of them has
> been proven yet (afaik). I tend to the "synchronicity" explanation - at
> least when pure logical devices such as computers are used, which I
> believe can't be influenced mentally, neither by spirits nor by humans
> (otherwise they would probably crash more often than already without
> such a manipulation). ;)
> 
> I think that causal models aren't sufficient to explain EVP. If no
> devices are influenced directly, there must be taking place some other
> form of "manipulation". Perhaps the "probability field" is manipulated
> somehow in cases where random number generators (RNG) are involved? As
> we know from psychokinesis experiments in parapsychological labs, test
> persons were able to get "hits" even when "prerecorded targets" are used
> instead of a RNG. It seems that time and causality doesn't matter in
> respect to paranormal phenomena.
> 
> Stefan
>
